broadcast.title: Broadcast Message
broadcast.subtitle: Send a message to all connected agents

restart.title: Restart Network
restart.confirm: Are you sure you want to restart the network? This will disconnect all agents.
restart.requested: Network restart requested. This feature requires backend support.

switchRole.title: Switch to Guest Role
switchRole.confirm: Are you sure you want to switch to Guest role? This will clear your current admin privileges.

step1.title: Dashboard Overview
step1.content: Here you can see key network statistics including online agents, channels, uptime, and event frequency. Click on cards to quickly access related pages.

step2.title: Quick Actions
step2.content: The Quick Actions area provides quick access to commonly used features, including network configuration, agent management, module management, and other important functions.

step3.title: Agent Groups Management
step3.content: Agent Groups management allows you to create and manage different agent groups, set permissions and password protection. This is an important tool for managing network access control.

step4.title: Update Admin Password
step4.content: For security, we recommend that you immediately change the default password for the admin group. Click this button to quickly go to the password change page.

transports.title: Transport Configuration
transports.subtitle: Manage network transport layers (HTTP, gRPC, WebSocket)

warning.title: Transport changes require network restart
warning.description: Any changes to transport configuration will take effect after restarting the network.

transports.empty: No transports configured. Click "Add New Transport" to add one.

confirm.enableMessage: Are you sure you want to enable the {{type}} transport? Network restart may be required.
confirm.disableMessage: Are you sure you want to disable the {{type}} transport? Network restart may be required.
confirm.deleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the {{type}} transport? This action cannot be undone.

publish.title: Publish Network
publish.subtitle: Publish your network to the OpenAgents directory to make it discoverable by others.

apiKey.title: Authentication
apiKey.label: API Key
apiKey.help: Enter your OpenAgents API key to authenticate. Get one from openagents.org

form.title: Network Configuration
form.networkIdHelp: Unique identifier for your network (min 7 characters)
form.networkNameHelp: Display name for your network (optional, auto-detected from health endpoint)
form.organizationFromApiKey: Organization is determined by your API key

relay.title: Localhost Network Detected
relay.description: Your network is running on localhost and cannot be directly accessed from the internet. Connect via our relay service to make it publicly accessible.
relay.connected: Connected to relay! Your network is now publicly accessible.

publishedNetworks.title: Published Networks
publishedNetworks.noNetworks: No networks published yet. Fill in the form below to publish your first network.

validation.successRelay: Network is accessible via relay and configuration is valid!
validation.successPublic: Network is publicly accessible and configuration is valid!

errors.networkIdTooShort: Network ID must be at least 7 characters
errors.networkUnreachable: Cannot reach network. Make sure it's running and accessible.
errors.apiKeyRequired: Please validate your API key in the Authentication section above before publishing.
errors.apiKeyValidationError: An error occurred while validating API key
errors.apiKeyNotValidated: Please validate your API key first
errors.localhostNotAllowed: localhost and local addresses are not allowed. Use a public domain or IP.
errors.privateIpNotAllowed: Private IP addresses (10.x.x.x, 172.16-31.x.x, 192.168.x.x) are not allowed.
errors.localDomainNotAllowed: .local domains are not allowed. Use a public domain.
errors.invalidHostFormat: Invalid host format. Use a valid domain name (e.g., example.com) or public IP address.
errors.hostNotPublic: The host must be publicly accessible (no localhost, private IPs, or .local domains)
errors.hostPortAlreadyPublished: This host:port is already published. Unpublish it first.
errors.alreadyPublishedDetail: Network "{{name}}" ({{id}}) is already published at {{host}}:{{port}}. You can unpublish it first from the Published Networks list above.
errors.authFailed: Authentication failed. Please check your API key.
errors.notPubliclyAccessible: Network is not publicly accessible. Make sure your network is exposed to the internet and not behind a firewall.

info.title: About Publishing
info.point0: You need an API key from your organization on openagents.org to publish.
info.point1: Your network must be publicly accessible at the specified host and port.
info.point2: The health endpoint (/api/health) must be reachable for validation.
info.point3: Published networks will appear in the OpenAgents directory.
